subject: Re: [junit] Testing super-class contracts (test case reuse)
msgSnippet: ...  ... http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?AbstractTestCases J. B. Rainsberger, President, Diaspar Software Services Let s write software that people understand.
messageBody:
>So said Tharp, Joshua L, SOLGV on 2003-06-19 --------------------
<snip />
>Problem:
>
>I would like to have a set of functional tests (black-box style) that
>enforce the behaviors of the super class, java.io.InputStream. Then use
>that same set of tests to ensure that the basic contracts for each of
>the classes I write follow that contract (i.e. pass those generic
>tests). Does anyone have a suggestion for doing this? While this
>specific example pertains to java.io.InputStream the same scenario may
>occur with any class hierarchy.

http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?AbstractTestCases


J. B. Rainsberger,
